AWS KMS [color=#f1fa8c](SSE-KMS)[/color]

table
Customer managed keys
Not SSE-C		 AWS managed keys AWS owned keys
cross account Cross account NOTâŒregion No Cross account/regionğŸŒ
Key policy Exclusively controlled by the customer Controlled by service; viewable by customer Exclusively controlled and only viewable by the AWS service that encrypts your data
Logging CloudTrail customer trail or event data store CloudTrail customer trail or event data store Not viewable by the customer
Lifecycle management Customer manages rotationğŸ”„, deletionğŸ—‘ï¸ and Regional locationğŸ“ AWS KMS manages rotation (annual), deletion, and Regional location AWS service manages rotation, deletion, and Regional location
Pricing Monthly fee for existence of keys (pro-rated hourly).
Also charged for key usage 		No monthly fee; but the caller is charged for API usage on these keys No charges to customerğŸ

[color=#f1fa8c]S3 static website[/color]
>âš ï¸Amazon S3 website endpoints do notâŒ support HTTPS or access points, 
use  
  >[color=#f1fa8c]AWS Amplify Hosting [/color] or 
  >Amazon CloudFront

>Website endpoints(return [color=#50fa7b]HTML[/color]) are different from the endpoints REST API requests(return [color=#50fa7b]XML[/color])

>instead of website endpoints use domain registered with [color=#f1fa8c]Amazon Route 53
or DNS CNAME[/color] of your own registered domain name

[color=#f1fa8c]replication[/color]

1. Live ( âš ï¸wont replicate object before setting enabled )
  a. Cross-Region Replication (CRR)
  b. Same-Region Replication (SRR)
2. Ondemand

[color=#50fa7b]bi-directional replication[/color]  is a special type of CRR with 2way sync

source and destination buckets must have [color=#50fa7b]versioning[/color] enabled.

ğŸ‘ŒReplica can be in a different storage class

source: enable both source/target region
target: enable target region
